DataElement.preferredName: Tobacco Product Sponsorship Exposure Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The dried cured leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, used for smoking, chewing, or snuff.  Tobacco contains nicotine, a stimulant, and other biologically active ingredients having carcinogenic properties._The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced._A person or organization that supports or champions something._The act of subjecting someone or something to an influencing experience._Money, or other support, given to an individual or group to help pay for something or carry out an event, usually in return for advertisement._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, dried and prepared for smoking or ingestion.
